item.title: The Great Waves in Economic History
item.description:
Introduction Economists often state that economic growth simply did not exist before recent times. The orthodox view that I was taught as an undergrad is that sustained economic growth began in the late 18th century. This view is articulated by economic historians like Clarke (2007). DeLong (2022) goes even further. He claims that modern economic growth ‚Ä¶

URL: https://rafaelrguthmann.substack.com/p/the-great-waves-in-economic-history?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web
